oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.data

Class SpatialIndexInputDataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.data.SimpleInputDataSet
      • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.data.FileInputDataSet
        • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.data.SpatialIndexInputDataSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationStorable, AbstractInputDataSet, IODataSet
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InputDataSet

    public class SpatialIndexInputDataSet
extends FileInputDataSet
    Represents a spatially indexed data set. An instance of this class points to a previously generated spatial index.
    Author:
    hsaucedo

    • Method Detail

      • getIndexMetadataDir

        public java.lang.String getIndexMetadataDir()
        Gets the directory where the spatial index metadata can be found for this data set
        Returns:
        a path to the spatial index metadata directory

      • getIndexName

        public java.lang.String getIndexName()
        Gets the data set spatial index name
        Returns:
        a spatial index name

      • isInputIndex

        public boolean isInputIndex()
        Used for backward compatibility. Tells whether the input data set is a spatial index or not.
        Returns:
        true if the input data set is a spatial index

      • setIndexMetadataDir

        public void setIndexMetadataDir(java.lang.String indexMetadataDir)
        Sets the directory where the spatial index metadata can be found for this data set
        Parameters:
        indexMetadataDir - a path to the spatial index metadata directory

      • setIndexName

        public void setIndexName(java.lang.String indexName)
        Sets the data set spatial index name
        Parameters:
        indexName - a spatial index name

      • setInputIndex

        public void setInputIndex(boolean inputIndex)
        Used for backward compatibility. If set to true and the index name was not set but the inputString or path were set, it will treat the input as a spatial index. Not needed when index name is set.
        Parameters:
        inputIndex - true if the input data set is a spatial index
